title: Why is teemo not a jungle based champion? "Think about it."
body:
Why is Teemo laning? He's a scout.

He should be in the jungle*** scouting*** the enemy jungle. Giving his allies vision, setting up traps to protect lanes, and counter ganking with his invisibility.

Why is he not centered around this? Rito please. This is the perfect time to throw the guy a couple things to allow him to jungle. He doesn't really fit in the lanes. We love diversity in the jungle. Would be awesome as hell to see Teemo jungle in LCS too.

Edit - Oh wow I was just throwing out how I feel about it and this got a lot of approval. I don't really want a rework. Just something to make him work as a jungler. He can very well do it atm  just not as efficient as other junglers without some sort of kick in it. Just something simple to reduce damage taken from jungle could make it work better.

***Scout***
A soldier or other person sent out ahead of a main force so as to gather information about the enemy's position, strength, or movements.

The job of scouts is like you said, doesn't involve actively killing wild lives or other people, unless obviously for self defense reasons.

That's why he has nothing to do with jungling in League, he has no real incentive to kill random stuff in jungle, the only champs designed with actual jungling in mind are Reng and Kha, rest are kinda just there for gameplay purposes and nothing else.

There is just no reason to make him a jungle champ of some sort just because his title has something to do with running in bushlands or whatever, while he already serves this purpose well enough with his global vision/harass that comes from his ulti and roaming, and invisibility granted by his passive.

I've played Teemo jungle, and he works best as a counterjungler. Ward their jungle so you know where they're at, then with a combination of shrooms and your passive you can ambush them pretty easily most times.

I'd imagine it was really annoying.

Just jungled it and got all 4 first buffs. Started his red, then when Nocturne showed up killed him. Then I stole his blue while he respawned and cleared both my buffs. I then warded his jungle, farmed to 6 and owned his entire bottom half of the jungle (And dragon). 

EVERY TIME he tried to farm his bottom jungle, I'd see him enter through a ward, shroom the area and then stealth and ambush him. Killed him just about every time. 

That's why I think he's thematically a jungler. He can ACTUALLY ambush people here. Granted I abused the sh*t out of his team's poor vision and it'd be much less effective in higher ELO, but it was fun as Hell.

Real talk though:  if his team had any form of ward coverage early on (and the top laner or bot laner(s) always should ward the bush that overlooks the river entry to red, and he should be guarding it for the first 30-40ish seconds of the game).

And if his team was smart and actually placed wards and worked together you would gave been forced out of there.

I like this a lot, but here are a few ideas:

* instead of moving the MS boost to his Q form switch, move it to his passive (to better facilitate ambushes)

* Having a form switch like this that only gives different bonuses (a la Jinx Q) would be excellent, but the melee bonuses would have to be significant enough to warrant ever being in that form. I think having a % missing HP on-hit effect while melee would be excellent, but it would have to have a low base (like 3% missing HP) and have an AP ratio.

* Your idea for W is a little weird, Teemo isn't a hunter, he is a scout/spec ops guerrilla fighter, so maybe something more oriented towards a sort of hit-and-run skirmishing style would be better suited to his kit (also, giving an assassin a hard CC is generally not a good idea, especially when he already has another one)

* I like that E is now an active, but since it is now an active, the poison DoT would have to stack with multiple hits to turn it into more of an assassination tool and less of an "I auto you once and make you hurt a lot" kind of spell. Basically, less up front DoT, but multiple stacks hurt a lot more than currently.

* I like the idea of charging mushrooms by moving rather than CD, it connects to his lore where he looks for shrooms in the jungle, and also would make him less of a pain in lane, but buff him as a jungler.

I agree with everything you said. If you remove the Q movement speed to put it on the passive, i think he could use some kind of gapcloser. The W could be change as a roll ? (They see me rollin' they hatin') I think it's more fun / interesting to use than a movement speed buff.  Also imagine teemo rolling. IMAGINE.

I actually had another Idea that would sort of reward Teemo for stalking into a lane and would serve to reinforce his scout identity while replacing an all out gapcloser.

Passive, Camouflage: If Teemo stands still for 2 seconds, he gains stealth for 4 seconds, as well as a 15% move speed buff. This refreshes infinitely as long as he stands still (but moving requires a full 2 stationary seconds to refresh the stealth again). On breaking stealth (by attacking or the buff wearing off), Teemo gains 35/50/75% AS for 3 seconds.

This isn't a true gapcloser, but it would help him gank a lane and adds to the secretive scouting aspect of his identity (he tries to get from one bit of cover to the next as quickly as possible) He could effectively stay stealth infinitely, but would have to gauge how much time he is wasting by standing still for the passive refresh and how much he should just use the MS and stealth to get in for a quick attack.

For W, maybe it could passively increase the MS buff his passive gives by 5/10/15/20/25% bonus (20/25/30/35/40% total). For an active how about something like: Killer's precision: for 6 seconds, your AAs and abilities cause you target to deal X% (maybe like 8/11/14/17/20%) less damage to you (only applies to the target last hit, and only reduces damage to Teemo) and you heal for a small amount on-hit while granting a small bit of movement speed (ideally with the heal scaling with AP).

I think giving him a true gap closer would kind of break him and remove a lot of cool options he could have, because then there would be no need for him to worry about how to get to melee range, or how to get out of a fight, and that would give us somebody like Nidalee or Fizz, and not a strategist like Teemo ought to be.

Hm...what would you give him to make him a better jungler? He doesn't really have any ganking tools, for example.

Map control. Holy mother of map control.

Roaming around shrooming EVERYWHERE, being impossible to hunt down in his jungle (because shrooms give vision) and having amazing ambush potential. If they amplified those things and toned back on the "annoying" factors of his kit, I think he would be pretty well off.
you don't think he offers enough map control currently? What are the "annoying" factors of his kit? How would you amplify his roaming and his ambush potential?

He certainly offers a lot of map control, but right now it is mostly "dang it I stepped on a shroom, have to back" and doesn't convert into any sort of major assassination potential like it should (that or "whoops, stepped on a shroom, lol" *walks away unharmed*). That is also equally what makes it so annoying, is that while the shrooms do little for Teemo unless he is lucky enough to be in the vicinity already, they are flat out obnoxious for the enemy team.

He already has a lot of map control, but my idea is to change *how* he controls the map. To do this, I would suggest any of these things: 

* Shroom CD is lowered.
* Shrooms deal less damage total but have a longer DoT duration.
* Shrooms apply some sort of debuff that amplifies Teemo's damage to that target, but can only effect one enemy at a time.
* If an enemy steps on a shroom, Teemo gains MS towards them/gains stealth for a few seconds before triggering his passive's bonus AS.
* Shrooms have greater vision radius
* Teemo gains a one time bonus damage proc of a sort when attacking an enemy that stepped on a shroom (once per shroom would ok, but having an internal cooldown would also be a way to manage it).

For better assassination and ambush power, I suggest any of these changes:

* Passive grants stealth for 4 seconds when standing still for 2 seconds (buff duration refreshes as long as he is immobile). This could allow for some really sick stealth shuffling around the map, and some pretty insane banks if he is patient enough, like stealth>move for 1 second>re-stealth>move>re-stealth etc. Sort of like he is sneaking around behind enemy lines or something of the sort.
* Passive's AS bonus increases with level (like 40/55/80% Bonus AS on breaking stealth)
* Like someone below suggested, change his Q to a form swap (between dart gun and knife) dart gun has a blind on the first attack after switching, and knife deals missing health bonus damage.
* Change E to an active where the poison DoT stacks with consecutive hits, but starts out lower and isn't always active.
